data.prayer: Jesus, please raise up evangelists to equip your people to share the gospel in Gulu.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Gulu, Uganda
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Gulu, Uganda to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 3 lost neighbors

data.prayer: God, we pray for the believers in Gulu, Uganda that they will know how to spend an hour in prayer with you.
Spirit, instill a desire within the people of the state of Gulu to hide your Word in their heart.
data.verse: I have hidden your Word in my heart that I might not sin against you.

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Swahili people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Swahili people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Swahili people is yours.
Spirit, encourage the disciples in Gulu, Uganda to live with urgency and a passion for making more disciples.
data.verse: Yet you do not know what your life will be like tomorrow. you are just a vapor that appears for a little while and then vanishes away.

data.prayer: Father, help the 1,772,119 believers in Gulu to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 3,573,882 lost friends and neighbors.
Father, we pray for every movement leader and disciple in the state of Gulu, Uganda that they would have deepening intimacy with you.
data.verse: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.

location.name: Gulu
location.people_groups_list: Plains Bira, Arab, Lebanese, Meneng, Kaliko, Mvuba
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Plains Bira (2,000), Arab, Lebanese (15,000), Meneng (7,800), Kaliko (13,000), Mvuba (1,200)
